workflow.name: Gmail AI search assistant on Telegram (Gemini-powered)
workflow.description:
# Overview
The n8n Telegram Gmail Assistant is an intelligent workflow that lets you search and retrieve specific Gmail emails simply by messaging a Telegram bot. Powered by advanced language models, it turns plain-language requests into precise Gmail searches, delivering results directly to your Telegram chat. This no-code automation is perfect for users who want instant, conversational access to their inbox‚Äîno Gmail tab required.

## Key Features
**Conversational Email Search:** Just message the Telegram bot with requests like ‚ÄúGet me all emails from Amazon‚Äù or ‚ÄúShow unread emails after 6 June 2025.‚Äù The assistant understands sender names, keywords, and date filters‚Äîeven if you only provide part of the information.

**AI-Powered Query Parsing:** Uses a language model (LLM) to intelligently extract sender, keywords, and date range from your message, then builds an accurate Gmail search query.

**Flexible Filtering:** Supports sender, keywords, ‚Äòafter‚Äô and ‚Äòbefore‚Äô dates, or any combination. Handles both specific and broad queries.

**Instant Telegram Delivery:** Each matching email is formatted with date, sender, subject, and a snippet, and sent as a separate Telegram message for easy reading.

**Customizable & Extendable:** Swap the AI model (Google Gemini or OpenAI), adjust output formatting, and set email limits or read status as needed.

## How It Works

1. **User Sends a Telegram Message:** For example, ‚ÄúGet unread emails from Amazon about invoices after 1 June 2025.‚Äù
2. **AI Interprets the Request:** The workflow‚Äôs LLM agent extracts sender, keywords, and date filters, converting them into a Gmail search query using Gmail‚Äôs syntax (e.g., from:amazon AND (invoice OR invoices) AND after:2025/06/01).
3. **Gmail Search:** The workflow fetches all matching emails from your connected Gmail account.
4. **Message Formatting:** Each email is summarized into a concise, emoji-rich Telegram message (date, sender, subject, snippet).
5. **Telegram Delivery:** Results are sent to your Telegram chat, one message per email.

## Setup Instructions
1. **Create a Telegram Bot:** Use @BotFather on Telegram to create a bot and obtain the API token.
2. **Connect Telegram to n8n:** Add your bot‚Äôs API token as a credential in n8n.
3. **Connect Gmail Account:** Authorize your Gmail account in n8n, set email limits, and choose read/unread status preferences.
4. **Configure AI Model:** Use your own Google Gemini or OpenAI API key, or select a preferred LLM node in the workflow.
5. **Deploy the Workflow:** Activate the workflow and start messaging your Telegram bot to retrieve emails instantly.

## Value Proposition

- **Save Time:** No need to open Gmail or remember search operators‚Äîjust ask in plain language.
- **Stay Organized:** Instantly filter and retrieve important emails, even on the go.
- **User-Friendly:** No coding required, with clear setup steps and customizable options.
- **Cost-Effective:** Available simply with an n8n subscription‚Äîno extra costs or hidden fees of anything. Enjoy the workflow Free Forever within your n8n plan.

parameters.text:
=Convert this email data into a well-formatted Telegram message with these sections:
1. üìÖ Date (DD/MM/YYYY format)
2. üë§ Sender (extract name & email)
3. üìå Subject
4. ‚úÇÔ∏è Preview (full snippet)

Rules:
- Use emojis for visual separation
- Keep entire message under 400 characters
- Format dates as "09/06/2025"
- Extract names from "From" field (remove quotes/email)
- Full snippets that conveys the full summarised email (max 4 lines)

Example Output:
üìÖDate:  09/06/2025  
üë§Sender: elad malka (example@gmail.com)
üìåSubject Line: Share request for "Acuity to Sheets"  
‚úÇÔ∏èSnippet: Requesting access to spreadsheet: Acuity to Sheets 

Email Data: 
date: {{ $json.Date }}
from: {{ $json.From }}
subject: {{ $json.Subject }}
sender: {{ $json.snippet }}

=Analyze the user's request (User request:{{ $json.message.text }} )  about fetching Gmail emails and output a JSON with:
1. `sender` (name or email, if specified).
2. `keywords` (list of words/phrases to search for).
3. `afterDate` (ISO format: YYYY-MM-DD, ONLY if user specifies "after [date]" or "since [date]").
4. `beforeDate` (ISO format: YYYY-MM-DD, ONLY if user specifies "before [date]" or "until [date]").

Rules:
- Convert relative dates (e.g., "since Monday") to ISO format using TODAY as reference.
- For ambiguous dates (e.g., "last week"), use the afterDate (calculated from present date to last 7 days).
- Strictly return ONLY valid JSON.

Examples:

User Input: "Get emails from Amazon after 2024-06-10 about returns"
Output:
```json
{
  "sender": "Amazon",
  "keywords": ["returns"],
  "afterDate": "2024-06-10"
}

parameters.content:
## 1. Telegram Bot (API)
1. Create a bot using Bot_Father on telegram by sending a message to @BotFather.

2. Send a command /newbot in the message.

3. Choose username and then copy the api.

4. Create Telegram credential here in n8n. By inputting the api token in access token and base url (https://api.telegram.org).

5. Hit Save.
Replace the API with your own API of Gemini or choose an OpenAi node if you want to use openai model. (depends on your choice).
Replace the API with your own API of Gemini or choose an OpenAi node if you want to use openai model. (depends on your choice).

## 2. Connecting Your Gmail Account.

1. Connect your Gmail account ‚Äì Choose the account you want to retrieve emails from.

2. Set the email limit ‚Äì Enter the number of emails you want to fetch, or check "Return all" to retrieve every email matching your request.

3. Select read status ‚Äì Choose whether to fetch unread or read emails.

## 3. Chat ID.

1. Get the Chat ID ‚Äì Copy the output from the first Telegram trigger node, then pass it to an AI model to extract the Chat ID.

2. Use the Chat ID ‚Äì Once identified, simply drag and drop the Chat ID value into the field.

nodes.name: Set Parameters From User Request (for fetching emails)

filters.sender: ={{ $('Set Parameters From User Request (for fetching emails)').item.json.Sender }}
filters.receivedAfter: ={{ $('Set Parameters From User Request (for fetching emails)').item.json.afterDate }}
filters.receivedBefore: ={{ $('Set Parameters From User Request (for fetching emails)').item.json.beforeDate }}

message.text: Hey get me summary of all the emails by elevenlabs

main.node: Set Parameters From User Request (for fetching emails)
